verse:
न तत्र सूर्यो भाति न चन्द्रतारकं नेमा विद्युतो भान्ति कुतोऽयमग्निः।
तमेव भान्तमनुभाति सर्वं तस्य भासा सर्वमिदं विभाति

terms.न तत्र सूर्यो भाति: The sun does not shine there
terms.न चन्द्रतारकं: Nor the moon and the stars
terms.कुतोऽयमग्निः: From where then does this fire shine?
terms.तस्य भासा सर्वमिदं विभाति: His light illuminates all of this.

meaning: Meaning:This verse metaphorically explains the concept of the Supreme Being, who is beyond the material world and is the source of all light and illumination. It states that the sun, moon, stars, and lightning do not shine in that realm, suggesting that these physical sources of light are insignificant in comparison to the divine light. The verse asks, if these physical sources do not provide light in that realm, then from where does the fire shine? The answer is given in the second half of the verse that only the Supreme Being shines and illuminates everything. It emphasizes that His light is the source of all illumination in the universe.
